website_summaries.verdict: The Panasonic Lumix G X Vario 12-35mm F2.8 ASPH. is the company's take on a pro-level standard zoom, but softness at the edges and a high asking price hold it back.
pros: Maximum f/2.8 aperture throughout zoom range

customer_reviews.title: JOY to carry around for most of your serious photographic needs!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first splurge lens purchase as I'm just an amateur prosumer photographer and I am so pleased with it! I bought used, but I immediately noticed the material quality in the metal barrel, manual zoom is very smooth for videography, and even in lowlight situation this lens delivered. Produces wonderful bokeh for close up shots of items, slight focus hunting mid-range but I think that's more of my composing fault, and AMAZING for video. The details were so crisp that when viewed 4K, I actually gasped haha. While it is a expensive glass, you get what you pay for. A hi-quality lens that will be with me for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Eric honestly opinionated K.

customer_reviews.title: For videos, it's excellent. For photography, it's good. Overall, it's great.
customer_reviews.text: About $200 cheaper than the second version but I'd have a hard time justifying the extra $200. The focus is blazing fast, the IS is great and it's sharp. Actually one of the fastest lenses I've got on my Panasonic G85. But to keep this short, need a really great lens for video? Stop looking, get this one. Need a great photography lens? Actually, this one is pretty good, there are betters out there but you should have an eye on the primes. Need a great overall lens? This is a very strong candidate! Fast aperture, great IS, super fast focus, superb build.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$$ if you can afford it
customer_reviews.text: This is going to be one of my 'goto' lens. It along with the 35-100 lens mans I need only 3 lens for practically and photographic trip. It is very good in low light situations as well as outside due to the extra stablization mechanism built in to it.It also keeps the same aperture no matter how 'zoomed in' the lens is. That's important for getting good pictures in low light. this is the 12-35 lens, so the zoom is not really a normal zoom lens. However it does mean that I can use it for portraits as well as for landscapes.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D Bechdol

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens it, fast and sharp with weatherization and optional lens stabilization. It's heavy for a Panasonic but worth its weight in gold in performance. It's zoom range and functionality is excellent and all you would need if you only buy one lens. I use it with a Pany GX 8. This gives you dual IS and low light capabilities. I loves the photographs this lens produces. Read the reviews and tech specs.
customer_reviews.author: H.E. TyreeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Glass for 4K
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens. Lightweight and fairly durable. The only two things I'm not a fan of are 1) I feel like dropping it would completely destroy it, and 2) not a huge fan of the bokeh. Other than that, it's super sharp and I love having the version 1, since I don't think the v.2 is worth the extra $500 for a stop. Highly recommend as a versatile first kit lens. Produces GREAT, sharp 4K video. I use it daily for vlogging and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Bought for weather sealing and wide angle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens after owning the Panasonic 14-140mm f/3.5-5.6 and 45-200mm f/4-5.6 because it is weather sealed and the 12mm wide-angle for landscape shooting. For me, the current "reduced" cost of close to $900 is well worth the money. The shallower depth of field for portraits has produced much higher quality photos than either of my first 2 MFT lenses which I have traded in. But I also keep my Fujiflm X30 for discreteness when street shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Denny Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sharp and light lens. Love my OM 5 and this is a very fast lens. A must have. Good travel lens as now I don't have to carry more than one. I have the 24-150 Olympus and I hated it. Very slow and terrible in low light and ANY motion. This is a peach lens.
customer_reviews.author: judith leclerc

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens, even if it is very pricey
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched from a canon digital SLR over to the micro four thirds technology. I bought this lens hoping it would give me similar capability like my old 70-200/f4 canon (white) lens did. Wow, did it deliver! Its not exactly the same, but it comes pretty darn close and in a much smaller setup. I've used it to photograph figure skating competitions in poorly lit arenas and had great results. if you are looking for a fast, long zoom lens, this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: tommyr

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice lens, but I recommend you to purchase the ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice lens, but I recommend you to purchase the new version, cause this one flicker when zooming. If this lens had a wider aperture, It would be everything that you would really need for an average gh4 filmaking project, but since it's 2.8, you should buy at least one faster prime lens to go with it, so you get more bokeh from it.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Peixoto Cerqueira

customer_reviews.title: A compact, light weight, and high quality lens
customer_reviews.text: It is a really great lens for m43 systems. It is light, compact, and weather sealed. Its image quality is outstanding, the same as my outstanding Canon 70-200 F4L IS, which has the reputation of being an excellent lens. I also own Olympus 40-150mm F2.8 PRO, which is slightly sharper than this lens and builds better, but also a lot larger and heavier. I ended up using this lens more often because of its size and weight advantages. This lens also has image stabilizer, which works better than in-body image stabilizer when the focus length is long.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lang

customer_reviews.title: Excellent MFT Zoom
customer_reviews.text: This has become my always on the OMD EM5 lens. It is fast, sharp and the perfect size. I don't use my awesome primes as much since this so so good. I have the Nikon Nano 24-70 2.8 on my D800 and as you all know, it weighs a ton. This lens with this camera is hard to beat. It is tack sharp and until the Oly version comes out next month it is THE lens to have. Keep in mind that the OLy will be a bigger lens, but less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: RML

customer_reviews.title: if you own a Micro Four Thirds camera and need a good walking around lens
customer_reviews.text: A bit of advice, if you own a Micro Four Thirds camera and need a good walking around lens, this is it. 12 - 35 MM is great for Landscapes and subject shooting. The only downsides I see to this lens is that it's a bit heavy and it's not as sharp as some prime lenses but it's still a great lens.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Amick

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lens. Read any of the other reviews for ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lens. Read any of the other reviews for more specifics on the specs of the lens. Bottom line... it takes very sharp pictures, and with a fast 2.8, this thing did surprising well in my recent test indoors at a friends party. This thing is so good i may purchase the 12-35mm as well.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Heick

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This lens provides a field of view that is similar to Canon's 24-70mm ƒ2.8 on a full frame body. I'd say the sharpness is as good. The 12-35mm range is great for full figure or environmental portrait photography. I use 25mm for head to toe shots and 35mm for three quarter. 12mm works well if I need to distort or to add some drama to an environmental shot. In a pinch I'll use 35mm for a head shot, but prefer to swap this out for Oly's 45mm or 75mm prime.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Dunn

customer_reviews.title: In lens stabilization is great (would be awesome to use this with the gh5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Must have for the gh4. In lens stabilization is great (would be awesome to use this with the gh5 and have stabilization in the lens and the body, maybe someday I can afford that). Super sharp, compact, lightweight, and so far seems durable. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Spin

customer_reviews.title: If I had to pick just one!
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens, before going on a trip I bought this knowing I didn't want carry all of my lenses. I wanted one go to Lens with just enough flexibility as a trade-off for wait. This 12 to 35 performed brilliantly riding bikes across Europe camera swinging off my side.
customer_reviews.author: Rc

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to M4/3 Prime Lenses!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This is already the default lens on my Olympus OM-D. Besides being weatherproof and providing that wonderful 24-70 mm equivalent range, it is a really, really well-built lens. Completely rock solid with great clarity on the camera. It is expensive, but for someone moving to a complete Micro Four-Thirds system who need the flexibility of a zoom on camera at times, this lens is a current must have. For me, it's proving to be a great addition to the Panasonic 25mm/f1.4 and Olympus 75mm/f1.8 prime lens that I already carry with me!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Klein

customer_reviews.title: It's a beauty of a lens
customer_reviews.text: It's a beauty of a lens. I wanted the longer zoom because I could not get the nice medium distance headshots with the Panasonic 12-35 mm. At its minimum focus, the background is nicely blurred and I get nice bokeh. Not heavy and a nice complement to the 12-35 mm.
customer_reviews.author: BT River

customer_reviews.title: Great lens .
customer_reviews.text: i love this lens, both for its physical size and weight and for its super image quality. It may not be up to the amazing quality of the olympus pro lens but its pretty close . Since Olympus has yet to have a delivery date on there lens i was forced to make the decision to buy the Lumix lens and im glad i did.
customer_reviews.author: vince m

customer_reviews.title: Excellent M43 zoom
customer_reviews.text: Tack sharp, fast, constant aperture, constant physical length throughout the zoom range, very small for its specs, effective in-lens IS, even with an Oly OM-10. This is an amazing lens.
customer_reviews.author: RMT232

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have Lens for Panasonic GH4
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Panasonic GH4 earlier this year, and this is the lens I use most of the time. It has a gorgeous aesthetic, the range is great for a wide variety of situations, and the stabilization works very well. If you can only get one lens for the GH4 to start, make it this one. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Good lens, maybe not a good value for some people
customer_reviews.text: This is the Micro 4/3 version of the common 24-70/2.8 lens that's found in most professional kits. I'll use it for personal and travel photography, and as a carry-around camera at work when I don't want to haul larger equipment. Image quality is very good to excellent. Some vignetting in the corners at f/2.8, gone by f/4. The image stabilization works very well. I prefer the convenience of zoom lenses, and this is the best standard zoom for this system. The price is rather high, though of course it's a lot less than comparable lenses for full-frame cameras. Combined with the 7-14 and either the Olympus 75 or the Panny 35-100 it would make a complete high-quality travel kit.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Optics
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. F2.8 over the entire zoom range makes a big difference in low light, and in the resolution under normal circumstances. Size is great for such a lens (24 to 70 mm equivalent in 35 mm camera terms). The cost is high, but if you want outstanding picture quality, it's the price of quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moon

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but classy
customer_reviews.text: You can get a standard micro 4/3rds lens for a lot less but this one brings you up to the Canon L lens class. Maybe not that good but pretty darn good and after I have experienced it a bit more I might like it even better. Sharp, very sharp and the f2.8 at 35mm (70 effective) is a very good portrait "taker".
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Professional quality
customer_reviews.text: Very very nice lens. I use it for video and occasional stills. I like the fact that focusing is done using internal elements. Unlike a full frame cameras which I shot in the past, 2.8 is not wide enough for MFT to achieve cinematic bokeh, so a fast prime is indispensable.
customer_reviews.author: AVS

customer_reviews.title: Great lens! Must have for gh4!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lens! If you've got a gh4 this is a must have for your kit, light weight and as smooth as butter! Not to mention the prestine image quality! Does great in low light, be sure to pick up the gh4 guide by Andrew Reid EOSHD
customer_reviews.author: Carlos M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Video
customer_reviews.text: A great lens for shooting video on my Lumix GX7. Very steady, smooth zooming, crisp video.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice! Noticeable improvement in photo quality over the 14-140mm and (obviously) the 100-300mm lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Wian F. Xbut

customer_reviews.title: Must have lens with GH3
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have lens for any Panasonic Shooter. Well built and moisture and dust resistant. Great as an all around lens if you want to travel with just one lens. Great focal range and aperture and with the GH3 the image stabilization can provide clear sharp pictures in dim lighting.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 70-200 f/2.8 constant aperture zoom
customer_reviews.text: compared to my Canon 20-200 L f/2.8is MKII, and the results were very similar, no issues with sharpness what so ever with this, think of it as an L lens for m4/3
customer_reviews.author: EOSfan

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for MFT!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lens! Works great with my BMPCC. Excellent Image Stabilization.
customer_reviews.author: Troy D. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great low light
customer_reviews.text: Great for low light and vlogging. Dual IS. Good with G85
customer_reviews.author: Nate Z

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is sharp, fast, accurate and a fraction of the weight of my Nikon 2.8 28-70. It's pricey as hell (yeah, and I'm saving for the 35-100), but the results are there. Panasonic lenses on my OMD are a match made in heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C. Singer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best video lens while also being a great stills lens. THE necessary lens.
customer_reviews.author: J. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Simply Outstanding!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 35-100mm f/2.8 to compliment my 12-35mm f/2.8 and I absolutely love it. The image quality is amazing and the size is noticeably smaller and lighter than my Nikon 70-200mm f/2.8 (same focal range). The DOF isn't quite on par with my Nikon but trust me when I say, the image quality is. With all things considered (size, weight, image quality, and durability) there's nothing currently on the market that compares to this lens for Panasonic and Olympus M4/3 cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Drew830

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Purchased used on Amazon, but the lens looked and worked like new. A little pricey for a Micro 4/3rds lens, but the images are very sharp, especially stopped down to f/4. The ability to shoot wide-open @ f/2.8 from 35-100mm (70-200mm FF) is a real benefit for wildlife and outdoor use.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby F.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to use primarily with a gimbal mounted ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use primarily with a gimbal mounted GH4. The footage I am getting is very clean, sharp, and smooth. Prior to this, I was using a 25mm prime which performed well in stationary settings but I had a rough time getting smooth gimbal footage out of it. I am loving this rig a lot more now, it's OIS makes a BIG difference. Regarding compatibility with the GH5 and other newer bodies, I read in multiple places that Panasonic is going to be fixing this soon with a firmware update. In the meantime, it's not compatible but hopefully it will be released soon.
customer_reviews.author: arizonahd

customer_reviews.title: Super Lens!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this lens. Sharp and light weight .
customer_reviews.author: R. Bloemers

customer_reviews.title: My goto lens
customer_reviews.text: This is my most used lens. It is wonderfully sharp and fast and unbelievably small and light in comparison to a full frame 70-200. The reviews do not lie.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Woodard

customer_reviews.title: This is a very fine lens. Also
customer_reviews.text: Paired with the BMPCC ( Blackmagic Pocket Cinema Camera ) this lens is guaranteed to get some stellar footage. This is a very fine lens. Also, the OIS works extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Sepiol

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is light, sharp, and bright. The colors are great, and this lens doesn't disappoint. Truly fantastic (if expensive).
customer_reviews.author: Scott C. Singer

customer_reviews.title: Stellar
customer_reviews.text: This lens has caused me to rethink my relationship with my exceptional Canon 7d. The Olympus OM-D/Panasonic 12-35mm combo is masterful. This lens has turned a great camera into an exceptional tool. The build quality is on par with my Canon 70-200. The image quality is top notch and the obvious size/weight advantage over larger rival's lenses makes this lens ideal for taking everywhere! This price is high, but my apprehension quickly dissipated after I attached it to the OM-D and began snapping pics/videos. The smooth and steady focus ring as well as the constant 2.8 make it ideal for videos. I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Nice colors and came with lens hood. Produces sharp images and great for videos!
customer_reviews.author: Asaph

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: unreal for 24-70/2.8 in size, weight, cost and QUALITY. who wouldn't want to carry a lens of this type in their coat pocket!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Lafferty

customer_reviews.title: Although it is not as good in low light as some of the Leica and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding lens. Although it is not as good in low light as some of the Leica and Nikon glass I own, it actually gets more use. The zoom range is of 12-35 mm (which is approximately 24-70 equivalent}. As it turns out, this is a pretty good 'walkabout' range. While there are a few situations that call for other lenses, this lens stays on my GH4 most of the time. It would probably go well with the Olympus OM-D E-M1 as well.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang C

customer_reviews.title: Great lens, especially for the GH5
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful lens, although I wish it could be zoomed while shooting video without having the exposure ramp up or down. It sort of "flashes" as you go through the zoom lens range. It keeps consistent exposure when you've stopped re-framing, but this doesn't allow for snap zooms or the like. But, the color rendition is good, it's sharp without vignetting wide, so all in all it's a great lens. It also has fantastic built-in image stabilization, and coupled with IBIS on the GH5 it's mind blowingly steady.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Uken

customer_reviews.title: Good lens w/ OMD
customer_reviews.text: This is the main lens for my OMD. It has good contrast and color saturation. I love the look that I can get from this lens. The main issue with is is that there is no CA correction when using with non-Panasonic bodies. It's not really a big deal since a lot can be easily fixed in Adobe LR or similar software. Although for a lens over $1000 you would hope that the optics where good enough avoid CA.
customer_reviews.author: William Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very good lens
customer_reviews.text: Lens is sharp and produce lovely warm natural colours. I loved the Japanese order treatment, very gentle caring and very professional.
customer_reviews.author: Yves Renaud

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: This lens has outstanding build quality and the images it delivers are sharp and vibrant. This lens plus the 12-35 companion can cover everything from (in 35mm terms) 24 to 200 mm. Very hand for traveling and equally as good at any time.
customer_reviews.author: LMN

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lens
customer_reviews.text: Works well for doing indoor shots of musical events. I used it handheld (with its stability control) and got good results. (But, of course not as good as when using a mono or tri pod.) I am pleased that the lens remains roughly the same length when being zoomed.
customer_reviews.author: Sherman Oakes

customer_reviews.title: the only base lens needed
customer_reviews.text: i bought this after renting the lens for a week. The pictures I took were fabulous, great saturation and sharpness. Smaller than the 12-50 that came with my OM5, much better lens. Pricey, but all fast lenses are that are not primes, and in 43's even the primes are not cheap. Is my daily go to lens.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Gauthier

customer_reviews.title: Go-To Lens
customer_reviews.text: This has quickly become my go-to lens on my GH3. The image quality from this lens is amazing - very little image distortion (only the slightest bit when the aperture is wide open and you're zoomed in real close). The small size of the m4/3 format makes it very transportable in a backpack. I have hauled this lens all through the woods and have had no issues with moisture or dust.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Pantier

customer_reviews.title: Everything everybody says is true
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic lens. Compact with great build quality and very smooth action. You will not regret this purchase. I use it more than any other lens these days.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy G. Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Top optics and build
customer_reviews.text: Sharp f2.8 zoom, image stabilization, weather sealed, 24-70mm equivalent to nikon or canon. What more do you want? Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: ddarko

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful lens, inside and out.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Lens for my GH4, no chromatic aberrations, very sharp at 3.5 and sharp enough at 2.8 wile shooting at 4K. In the GH4 you have a lens that can compete with Canon's 24-70 L Lens for about $500 less. I added a Variable ND filter and you have a great all around lens for micro 4/3 cameras. Very well built, feels solid, the focus and zoom rings feel smooth but not loose, definitely a high quality lens inside and out
customer_reviews.author: Nruesga

customer_reviews.title: great lens
customer_reviews.text: just got this baby and very impressed. Smooth zoom, great color and will probably use as my street lens. I have a panny 20mm as well as an oly 45mm and this new lens makes me forget my primes. Have a epl-1 also and the 12-35mm works well with it. I know its a lot for a lens but good glass isn't cheap. Not sorry I went for the $!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth J. Connolly

customer_reviews.title: [VIDEOGRAPHY] Must have for GH4 kit! Great O.I.S.!!!
customer_reviews.text: Is it possible to fit such a great piece of glass into a small form factor? Yes. Great colors, great sharpness. As someone who made the switch from EOS to LUMIX, WOW. I. LOVE. MEGA O.I.S. Really, image stabilization is a BEAUTIFUL thing. If this lens was a fine wine, it would match perfectly with the GH4.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: great lens for the money
customer_reviews.text: amazing lens. I love panasonic's optics. Lightweight, solid construction, gives you a great image.
customer_reviews.author: scotty

customer_reviews.title: What You Would Expect.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for video on a GH4. Very clear but depth of field has to be fought for on a M4/3 camera with a wide lens in this focal range. Overpriced for what you get in my opinion. Otherwise everything works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable zoom
customer_reviews.text: I own many m4/3 lenses including the current top of the heap- both voights, oly 12 and 45, pana 20 and 25. I also use om f2: 100, 55, 35 and original pen 60 and 40 with my omD-em5. I can honestly say that this zoom is the only zoom that can keep up with these primes. It is weather sealed and lightweight. If you only wanted to buy one lens, this zoom is it. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mojokielbasa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens; possibly the sharpest lens I've owned for my micro-four third system. Only gripe is that it's bigger than I thought with hood attached; I had to use a bigger camera bag (orig. for Nikon 7000). It's also heavier than what I expected but then again...perhaps this is the lightest 70-200mm F2.8 constant zoom on the market at this time. At 200 F2.8 the sharpness is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Green Earth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a thing of beauty and the beauty is more than skin deep! It performs perfectly and it can stand up to fog, snow, and sprinkles!
customer_reviews.author: traveler

customer_reviews.title: Hell Yeah
customer_reviews.text: Works GREAT for video. Optical quality obviously isn't as good as using a prime and there's room for improvement with the image, but with that being said the I.S. is great, and I think it's the best zoom lens in this range for video. I've filmed some really great pieces with this and really enjoy the 2.8, nice bokeh.
customer_reviews.author: andrew Molle

customer_reviews.title: and the lens stabilization will be useful. Lens is sharp throughout the image
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with this or the Olympus 12-40. I chose this because I have a Panasonic camera, and the lens stabilization will be useful. Lens is sharp throughout the image, and I've already done some pro work with it.
customer_reviews.author: davonroe

customer_reviews.title: Super!
customer_reviews.text: Great lens! Good size and same filter size as the Pana 12-35mm. Course would love it in a f1.4 but beggars can't be choosers!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Get the most out of your 4/3 camera
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lens. I feel I get the most out of my GH3 using this lens. I do a lot of instructional videos that includes a lot of detailed work and this lens fits the bill for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: KJ in SD

customer_reviews.title: If you need a zoom then it's great but if you don't then stick to primes.
customer_reviews.text: Its a decently sharp lens with a nice zoom length but it does beat any primes and bokeh is a bit of hot mess. Not to mention CA's and minor flaring issues.... It's also slightly soft all the way at 100mm.
customer_reviews.author: Davinphx

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST LENS FOR MICRO FOUR THIRDS !
customer_reviews.text: THIS LENS IS AMAZING! I rented this lens for a while with lens rentals. After using this lens I realized it is probably one of the best lenses I have used for the micro four thirds mount. This is a great buy and amazing for weddings and events.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan C.

customer_reviews.title: The best Micro 4/3 all-around lens out there
customer_reviews.text: I sold my Canon Mark II with a 24-105 L-series in hopes that this lens combined with the Panasonic GH3 would fill the gap, and it has performed every bit as well as my L-series ever did and better because its faster and lighter. I'm very impressed - worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Selena D. Robins

customer_reviews.title: Great native lens for the GH4
customer_reviews.text: Great native lens for the GH4! Very small and compact yet gives super results. It stays on my camera during vacations and traveling because it will make due for just about any kind of shooting.
customer_reviews.author: endgame

customer_reviews.title: Best Lens I've Used
customer_reviews.text: Best lens I've ever used. I am an amateur, so that may not be saying much, but I love the clarity and the speed of this lens. It makes the cons of switching to micro 4/3 even more worth it.
customer_reviews.author: SopranogurlTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE for G7
customer_reviews.text: MUST HAVE! great stabilization for video, sharp!!!! very happy and worth the price. G7 + tiffen ND filter = great video!
customer_reviews.author: Sergio M.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact this has OIS and splash resistance. Love the constant aperture and vids look better than with the 12-60. Its a great fit with my G85 and Its worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: James Biesty

customer_reviews.title: Must have zoom for MFT cameras.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome lens! This being the MFT counterpart to the widely popular 70-200mm lens, I knew I had to grab it, and I have NOT been disappointed. Sharp focus, Power OIS, it works great! Also, something I didn't realize until I got it - The lens does NOT telescope when you zoom, like most zoom lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Randy A.

customer_reviews.title: Love this lens
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens, very sharp and doesn't physically change length with change in focal length. I use it on my Olympus OMD EM5 and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent all around lens that now sits permanently on my GH3. If used on this camera, I've found that you don't really need its sister lens of 35-100 as you can use the crop mode on your camera and extend the range! Just use the crop mode on one of your custom buttons and voila, you have two lenses in one!!! You can thank me later! :)
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to update the firmware!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent optics. Although this is "older" Power OIS lens, the latest firmware update brings it up to the capabilities of the newest lens. Be sure to update the firmware!
customer_reviews.author: Mark B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great lens for the GH series of Panasonic cameras that I have.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: My son says it works great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for Christmas. My son says it works great.
customer_reviews.author: David J.

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic LUMIX G X VARIO 12-35mm/F2.8 ASPH X Series Lens
customer_reviews.text: Panasonic developed the high end product, feels solid, weather resistance, OIS and constant speed @F2.8, IQ is sharp with a wide opening even in a lowlight situation. I have this lens about a week now, highly recommend this lens. One of the best M43 lenses that I own. My next lens is 35-100mm F2.8
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect lens for my Panasonic G4H camera! Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: in had to send back for repair no charge now OK
customer_reviews.author: Gnagna

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast AF Lens
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely was delighted the first time I used this lens. Needed an autofocus wide zoom lens with a fixed F-stop, and with this product Panasonic has developed a great product. Very crisp and sharp from edge to edge, too. Love this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Buller Photography

customer_reviews.title: I am delighted that I got it and for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: This is a remarkable lens. I am delighted that I got it and for a decent price. The seller is in Hong Kong and they payed for the import fees. What a nice transaction.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas McCune

customer_reviews.title: Great Glass!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great leans. Since it is the equivalent to a 70-200 on a full frame you can get right up a gopher's ass with this thing. I mean I was able to get pictures of the Statue Of Liberty from the ferry. This is a great piece of glass. If you can get a good copy used then go for it...hell, buy it new!
customer_reviews.author: Harry R.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Lens
customer_reviews.text: Expensive,yes, but worth every penny. All the other top rated reviews are spot on. This lens delivers. I can't wait for the rumored 135 mm f/2 or f/2.8?
customer_reviews.author: rtm

customer_reviews.title: A great lens if you have the money
customer_reviews.text: What a nice lens. I bought one from a 3rd party seller for a few hundred dollars off the list price. I must say the picture quality is excellent. Easy to install and perfect fit!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp lens that resolves beautiful detail and accurate colors.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Broadway

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a lemon?
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a bad copy... but the focus still shifts/hunts even when shooting in manual mode?! Happens when tracking a subject on the field and even more evident when you zoom the lens either in or out. I know the lens is not parfocal but I would expect it to remain static (no focus breathing our hunting) while just panning left our right and while just zooming. Could it be firmware? Poor connection between lens and the GH4 body? Not sure... in manual mode I expect the lens to stay at the focal position regardless of camera movement or zoom movement. I've tried the various AF modes (AF-S, AF-C, and Manual) - the behavior is consistent. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: VSSP

customer_reviews.title: I really love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens in "ASUKA from Japan shop"  When I ordered this product, I was really afraid because It was my first order from a shop base on abroad. Delivery was so fast, just 5 days from Tokyo to MA. And when I asked some question by e-mail, they answered so quickly. I got not only product but also a letter in handwriting and chopstick! I appreciate ASUKA from Japan shop's kind.
customer_reviews.author: shyany

customer_reviews.title: Professional quality pics & video
customer_reviews.text: We are not photographers, but every picture & video we take with this camera and lens are crystal clear and lifelike.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic 35-100/2,8 simply a very very good lens
customer_reviews.text: Considering its low weight and overall portability its a very good lens. With some postprocessing you cannot tell the difference between the Canikon versions. I am in the enthusiast catagory and I am no pixelcounter. I am in there just for the thrill of good pictures. Therefor this lens is so good in all aspects for me and I presume for most people who value the possibilty to easaly bring your stuff with you. I also use the P 12-35 and for very low light situations the P 20/1.7. I still have my FF Nikongear but most of the time the Panasonic is the camera I use.
customer_reviews.author: Hans Gaestadius

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Lets see within a year
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Lets see within a year. I ordered other zooms before and they made noise after few months...
customer_reviews.author: F.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT! but pricey
customer_reviews.text: I can not say enough good things about this lens. I absolutely LOVE IT! Wish it was cheaper though, Quality is a 5 star but the price is so far out to left field I have to rate it a 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp lens and easily as good if not better ...
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp lens and easily as good if not better than Nikon's or Canons finest. My 4/3 camera is now my favorite to shoot with on vacation or camping trips. The 14-42mm kit lens is pretty horrible, especially when you open two RAW files side-by-side at 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Thorsten Ott

customer_reviews.title: The Lumix 12-25 is your companion
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a light professional tool, and the Lumix GH3 with this lens is affordable, light, professional and versatile. It allow you to get a beautiful short deep of field.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Quick focus, great build. Very sharp. Always stays on my camera since I got it. Expensive but 1000 times better than the 14-42 kit that came with my G5.
customer_reviews.author: chacho

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Lens From Panasonic
customer_reviews.text: This lens is equivalent to a 35mm 70-200mm zoom, and with the fixed f-stop and clarity, extremely sharp glass this lens is absolutely beautiful. I would rather carry this lens on my camera than a 35mm version that weights like 5x's more. Panasonic is developing and delivering in to the market a brand new world of products for the digital photo and video industry. Oh, and did I mention how fast the AF is on this lens, too! Fabulous lens.
customer_reviews.author: Buller Photography

customer_reviews.title: Superb lens! Fast shipment!
customer_reviews.text: Lens came as new. I am very pleased with this buy. Service is excellent! Wonderful lens at this price. !
customer_reviews.author: kim freddy føreland

customer_reviews.title: A great lens. i mounted it on my GH4 and ...
customer_reviews.text: A great lens. i mounted it on my GH4 and the lens is sharp as a tack and love the auto focus.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mark

product_meta.title: PANASONIC LUMIX G X VARIO LENS, 12-35MM, F2.8 ASPH., PROFESSIONAL MIRRORLESS MICRO FOUR THIRDS, POWER OPTICAL I.S. H-HS12035 (2012 Model - USA BLACK)
product_meta.description:
Size:12-35MMProfessional grade X Series 12-35mm, F2.8 zoom lens

FROM THE MANUFACTURER





PANASONIC H-HS12035 LUMIX G X VARIO 12-35MM/F2.8 ASPH X SERIES LENS

PHOTOGRAPHY PROS APPRECIATE X VARIO TECHNOLOGY
The Panasonic H-HS12035 camera lens can focus on landscapes to studio lit portraits (View Larger) The Panasonic LUMIX G X VARIO camera lens represents the next natural step in design and build for digital interchangeable zoom lenses. A first for the LUMIX G Series, the G VARIO constant with F2.8 zoom is suitable for professionals and enthusiasts alike. You can focus on a wide range of scenes from dynamic landscapes to studio lit portraits. Panasonic’s long time collaboration with LEICA inspired an exclusive X Series design. With the X Series Lenses, LUMIX blends its own unique mix of broadcast video and advanced mirrorless camera technologies into a premium lens line. Featuring professional grade aperture in a compact body, use it in your professional studio photography.

PROFESSIONAL GRADE GLASS FOR GREAT IMAGES IN VARIOUS SHOOTING CONDITIONS
The H-HS12035 is comprised of 14 elements featuring high contrast resolution across the entire range (View Larger) The LUMIX G X VARIO interchangeable lens system is comprised of 14 elements in 9 groups. The UED (Ultra Extra-Low Dispersion) glass minimizes chromatic aberration while the UHR (Ultra High Refractive) lens realizes high descriptive performance from corner to corner. Featuring high contrast and resolution within the entire zoom range - the X VARIO lens highlights intricate details that command your attention lending a true-to-life portrait perspective in almost any scene. Advanced Focusing happens because seven blades give the aperture a rounded shape that produces an attractive smooth defocus effect for those out-of-focus areas. Mount it on any LUMIX G body and delight in high-speed Contrast Auto Focus.

POWER O.I.S. MINIMIZES BLUR AND ENHANCES IMAGES
Power O.I.S. strengthens the correction of low-frequency hand-shake vibration (View Larger) By integrating POWER O.I.S. (Optical Image Stabilizer), movement, whether slow or fast, is accounted for making your job easier to shoot in those low-lit situations at night or even indoors at a get-together. By adopting an inner focus system, driven by a stepping-in-motion motor, the lens’ superior design provides smooth and near-silent focusing action that is ideal for both picture and video recording.

CONSTRUCTED TO BE LIGHT AND DURABLE FOR YOUR PHOTO EXPEDITIONS
Outstanding compact and light-weight design offers the same level of performance as larger zoom lenses (View Larger) This interchangeable lens boasts about how light and compact it really is. As you travel, this zoom lens results in extreme mobility for your busy, on-the-go tour days and travel expeditions. It also protects against nature’s elements, countering moisture and dust with its rubber ring around the lens mount. It is ideal for outdoor photography enthusiasts. And a highly reliable metal mount assures long periods of use. Have fun and travel light.

NANO SURFACE COATING REDUCES REFLECTION
The Panasonic H-HS12035 Lens features Nano Surface Coating technology to reduce reflection (View Larger) With Panasonic’s unique Nano Surface Coating technology, reflections in the entire visual range (380nm-780nm) are minimized giving you a dramatic reduction in glares, flares and ghosting. The result? Unbelievably clear, professional pictures whose superior clarity tells more than a thousand words.

LENS COMPATIBLE WITH ALL PANASONIC LUMIX G SERIES AND MICRO 4/3 CAMERAS
DMC-GH3K Body
Panasonic LUMIX DMC-GH3 16.05 MP Digital Single Lens Mirrorless Camera with 3-Inch OLED DMC-G5K Body Only
Panasonic LUMIX DMC-G5 16 MP Digital Single Lens Mirrorless Camera with 3-Inch LCD DMC-GH2K Body Only
Panasonic LUMIX DMC-GH2 16.05 MP Live MOS Interchangeable Lens Camera DMC-GX1KK
Panasonic LUMIX DMC-GX1 16 MP Micro 4/3 Compact System Camera with 3-Inch LCD Touch Screen; Black, 14-42mm Kit 
DMC-G3KW, DMC-G3KBODY, DMC-G3KK, DMC-GH2HK, DMC-GX1KBODY,DMC-GX1SBODY, DMC-GX1XK, DMC-GX1KS, DMC-GX1XS, DMC-GF5XR, DMC-GF5XK, DMC-GF5XW, DMC-GF5KW, PDMC-GF5KK,DMC-GF5KR, DMC-GF3CT, DMC-GF3KR, DMC-GF3KBODY, DMC-GF3XK, DMC-GF3CR, DMC-GF3KW, DMC-GF3KT, DMC-GF3CW,DMC-GF3CK, DMC-GF3KK, DMC-GF2CS, DMC-GF2KK, DMC-GF2CK,DMC-GF2CW, DMC-GF2KS, DMC-GF2CR

feature_bullets: Moisture and dust sealed metal body and mount, 1-Year Limited Warranty
Ultra ED (UED) chromatic aberration reduction glass
POWER O.I.S with near silent drive optimized for video and still capture
Premium extra-low refractive index Nano Surface Coating (NSC).
